page.title: 15The Old Grammar School
page.content: Standing in the centre of Market Harborough is one of the towns historic buildings- the unique old{ {grammar school},which was endowed in 1614 by a former Harborian,{Robert {Smyth,}who had prospered in London as a merchant tailor and later as controller of the city.As requested by Robert Smyth the school was a timber framed building supported by wooden stilts with an open ground floor which was to serve as a market place for local people to sell butter,and as a shelter from the foul weather. He also stipulated that texts from scripture were to be painted on the side of the structure and if defaced or worn out were to be renewed . This building was used as a schoolroom for over three hundred and fifty years. Nowadays it is used for coffee mornings and jumble sales.
